CatDescriptText: Mr. James Gardner, laborer, 26 Tannehill Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think waitresses should be paid a minimum of $1 per hour plus tips?" answer reads: "I say yes. With the cost of living going up, waitresses must live also.  The service they give is worth $1 an hour plus tips."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Gardner wearing light colored short sleeve shirt and light colored pants with dark belt, standing with hands on hips on sidewalk with automobiles, buildings, and billboard in background
